snippet: A Robert Adams trove and a Whistler land at the National Gallery, while the Brooklyn Museum plans an El Anatsui show.
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; curators at the National Gallery of Art in Washington acquire 169 prints by photographer Robert Adams; Brooklyn Museum becomes the first museum in New York to present a solo exhibition by the 68-year-old African artist El Anatsui; Public Art Fund's fall 2012 season will feature three different public art projects installed around New York City.
lead_paragraph: A Robert Adams trove and a Whistler land at the National Gallery, while the Brooklyn Museum plans an El Anatsui show.

headline.seo: Robert Adams Chooses Photos for National Gallery
headline.main: Shaping a Legacy for the National Gallery
headline.print_headline: Shaping a Legacy for the National Gallery
